[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Integration] [Feature Flag Sync] Can desynchronization between Features, TimedFeatures, and on-chain feature flags cause some validators to execute natives differently, leading to state divergence and consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Integration] [Version Mismatch] If gas_feature_version is inconsistent across validators due to delayed upgrades, can this cause non-deterministic gas calculations and state root mismatches? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Integration] [Builder Reuse] Can SafeNativeBuilder instances be reused across multiple VM instantiations, and does this create shared mutable state that could lead to race conditions in multi-threaded execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Module Boundary] [Circular Dependencies] Can circular dependencies between natives.rs, aptos_vm.rs, and framework natives create initialization ordering issues where natives are called before proper initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Memory Safety] [Reference Lifetime] Are all references passed to native function builders guaranteed to outlive the native function table, or can dangling references occur if gas parameters are dropped prematurely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Concurrency] [Arc/Mutex] Does the SafeNativeBuilder use proper synchronization primitives if accessed from multiple threads, or can data races occur during native function registration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/natives.rs] [Deployment] [Reproducible Builds] Are native function tables deterministically constructed across different build environments, or can compiler optimizations, LLVM versions, or target architectures affect native registration order or behavior?
